[Three of [the women]231-the women]230-three of the women were of the kind that has no life apart from [committees]232-committees . [They]230-three of the women need not be mentioned in detail . The names of [two others]233-two others were [Miss Meta Mostyn Ford]96-miss ford and [Lady Arabel Higgins]97-lady arabel . [Miss Ford]96-miss ford was [a good woman]234-a good woman , as well as [a lady]235-a lady . [Her]96-miss ford hands were beautiful because [they]236-they paid [a manicurist]237-a manicurist to keep them so , but [she]96-miss ford was too righteous to powder [her]96-miss ford nose . [She]96-miss ford was [the sort of person [a man]239-a man would like [[his]239-a man best friend]240-his best friend to marry]238-the sort of person a man would like his best friend to marry . [She]97-lady arabel had [a husband]241-a husband , but no apparent tragedy in [her]97-lady arabel life . [These two women]242-these two women were obviously not native to [[their]242-these two women surroundings]243-their surroundings . [Old Mother London]109-old mother london crouches , with [her]109-old mother london face buried in [her]109-old mother london hands ; and [she]109-old mother london is walled in with [her]109-old mother london fogs and [her]109-old mother london loud noises , and over [her]109-old mother london head are the heavy beams of [her]109-old mother london dark roof , and [she]109-old mother london has the barred sun for a skylight , and winds that are but hideous draughts rush under [her]109-old mother london door . [London]1-london knows much , and every moment [she]1-london learns a new thing , but this [she]1-london shall never learn — that the sun shines all day and the moon all night on the silver tiles of [[her]109-old mother london dark house]335-her dark house , and that [the young months]336-the young months climb [her]109-old mother london walls , and run singing in and out between [her]109-old mother london chimneys .... Nothing else happened in [that room]337-that room . At least nothing more important than the ordinary manifestations attendant upon magic . The lamp had tremulously gone out . Coloured flames danced about [the Stranger]263-the stranger 's head . [One]277-one felt the thrill of a purring cat against one 's ankles , [one]277-one saw its green eyes glare . But these things hardly counted . It was all over . [The Mayor]110-the mayor was heard cracking [his]110-the mayor fingers , and whispering " [Puss]111-puss , [Puss]111-puss . "[110-the mayor] The lamp relighted itself . [Nobody]341-nobody had known that it was so gifted . [The Mayor]306-the mayor said : " Splendid , [miss]1354-miss , quite splendid . [You]1354-miss 'd make a fortune on the stage . "[306-the mayor] [His]110-the mayor tongue , however , seemed to be talking by itself , without the assistance of [the Mayor]306-the mayor [himself]306-the mayor . [One]277-one could see that [he]110-the mayor was shaken out of [his]110-the mayor usual grocerly calm , for [his]110-the mayor feverish hand was stroking a cat where no cat was . Black cats are only the showy properties of magic , easily materialised , even by [beginners]345-beginners , at will . It must be confusing for such an orderly animal as the cat to exist in this intermittent way , never knowing , so to speak , whether it is there or not there , from one moment to another . There are [six cells in [this house]1382-this house]487-six cells in this house , and [no common sitting - room]489-no common sitting - room . [Guests wishing to address each other]490-guests wishing to address each other must do so on the stairs , or in [the shop]406-the shop . [Each cell]492-each cell has whitewashed walls , and contains a small deal table , one wooden chair , a hard bed , a tin bath , and a little inconvenient fireplace . [No guest]493-no guest may bring into [the house]494-the house more than can be carried out again in one large suit - case . Carpets , rugs , mirrors , and any single garment costing more than three guineas , are prohibited . [Any guest]495-any guest proved to have made use of [a taxi]496-a taxi , or to have travelled anywhere first class , or to have bought cigarettes or sweets costing more than three shillings a hundred or eighteenpence a pound respectively , or to have paid more than three and sixpence ( war - tax included ) for a seat in [any place of entertainment]497-any place of entertainment , will be instantly expelled . Dogs , cats , goldfish , and [other superhuman companions]498-other superhuman companions are encouraged . [Working guests]499-working guests are preferred , but if not at work , [guests]500-guests must spend at least eighteen hours out of [the twenty - four entirely alone]501-the twenty - four entirely alone . [No guest]493-no guest may entertain or be entertained except under special license obtainable from [the Superintendent]503-the superintendent . There is a pump in [the back yard]504-the back yard . There is no telephone , no electric light , no hot water system , no attendance , and no modern comfort whatever . [Tradesmen]505-tradesmen are forbidden to call . [She]115-sarah brown thought [herself]115-sarah brown rather good at ideas — poor [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown , [she]115-sarah brown simply had to be confident about something . [Mitten Island]6-mitten island is [a place of fine weather]1515-a place of fine weather , [its]6-mitten island air is always like stained glass between [you]1516-you and perfection . Always [you]1516-you will find in the happy ways of [Mitten Island]6-mitten island a confidence that the worst is left behind , and that even the worst was not so very bad . [You]1516-you can afford to remember the winter , for even the winter was beautiful ; [you]1516-you can smile in the sun and think of the grey flush that used to overspread [the island]1517-the island under [its]1517-the island urgent crises of snow , and it seems that always there was joy running quickly behind the storms , joy looking with the sun through a tall window in a cloud . Even the most dreadful curtain of a winter 's day was always drawn up at sunset ; [its]1517-the island straight edge rose slowly , disclosing flaming space , and the dramatic figures of [the two island churches , exulting and undying martyrs in the midst of flames]1518-the two island churches , exulting and undying martyrs in the midst of flames . It is a place of fine weather , and this is a book of fine weather , a book written in Spring . [I]115-sarah brown will not remember the winter and the rain . It was the Spring that brought [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown to [Mitten Island]6-mitten island , and the Spring that first showed [her]115-sarah brown magic . It was the Spring that awoke [her]115-sarah brown on [her]115-sarah brown first morning in [the House of Living Alone]1519-the house of living alone . [She]115-sarah brown awoke because it was so beautiful outside , and because there was a beautiful day coming . [You]1516-you could see the day secretly making preparations behind a shining mist . [She]115-sarah brown heard a sound of breathless singing , and the whipping of stirred grass in [the garden]1520-the garden , the sound of [some one unbearably happy]1521-some one unbearably happy , dancing . Now there is hardly anything but magic abroad before seven o'clock in the morning . Only the disciples of magic like getting [their]1522-their feet wet , and being furiously happy on an empty stomach . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown went to [her]115-sarah brown window . The newborn trembling slants of smoke went up from [the houses of [the island]1517-the island]1523-the houses of the island . There was a sky of that quiet design which suffices half a day unchanged . [A garden of quite a good many yards]1525-a garden of quite a good many yards lay behind [the house]494-the house ; [it]1525-a garden of quite a good many yards contained no potatoes or anything useful , only long , very green grass , and a may tree , and [a witch]1367-a witch dancing . The extraordinary music to which [she]115-sarah brown was dancing was partly the braying of a neighbouring donkey , and partly [her]115-sarah brown own erratic singing . [She]115-sarah brown danced , as [you]1516-you may imagine , in a very far from grown - up way , rather like [a baby that has thought of a new funny way of annoying its Nana]1528-a baby that has thought of a new funny way of annoying its nana ; and [she]115-sarah brown sang , too , like [a child that inadvertently bursts into loud tuneless song , because it is morning and yet too early to get up]1529-a child that inadvertently bursts into loud tuneless song , because it is morning and yet too early to get up . A little wandering of the voice , a little wandering of the feet .... The may tree in the middle of [the garden]1520-the garden seemed to be [[her]115-sarah brown partner]1531-her partner . A small blot moved up and down the chequered trunk of the tree , and that was the shadow of a grey squirrel , watching the dancing . The squirrel wore the same fur as [the two - and - a - half - guinea young lady]1532-the two - and - a - half - guinea young lady wears , and sometimes it looked with a tilted head at [the witch]432-the witch , and sometimes it buried [its]1534-its face in [its]1534-its hands and sat for a while shaken with secret laughter . There was certainly something more funny than beautiful about [the witch]432-the witch 's dancing . [She]115-sarah brown laughed [herself]115-sarah brown most of the time . [She]115-sarah brown was wearing a mackintosh , which was in itself rather funny , but [her]115-sarah brown feet were bare . A voice broke in : "[115-sarah brown] Good for [you]572-you , [cully]573-cully . " It was [[Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown 's fellow - lodger]1536-sarah brown 's fellow - lodger leaning from [her]115-sarah brown window . The squirrel rippled higher up the may tree . The pleasure of the thing broke like an eggshell . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown turned back towards [her]115-sarah brown bed . It was too early to get up . It was too late to go to sleep again . [Eunice]131-eunice , [her]115-sarah brown hot - water bottle , [she]115-sarah brown knew , lay cold as a serpent to shock [her]115-sarah brown feet if [she]115-sarah brown returned . There are a good many things to do when [you]1538-you find [yourself]1538-you awake too early . It is said that [some people]1392-some people sit up and darn [their]1392-some people stockings , but [I]573-cully refer now to [ordinary people]1540-ordinary people , not to angels . [Utterly resourceless people]1541-utterly resourceless people find [themselves]1541-utterly resourceless people reduced to reading the penny stamps on yesterday 's letters . There is a good deal of food for thought on a penny stamp , but nothing really uplifting . [Some people]1392-some people [I]573-cully know employ this morning leisure in scrubbing [their]1392-some people consciences clean , thus thriftily making room for the sins of the coming day . But [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown 's conscience was dreadfully receptive , almost magnetic ; little sins like smuts lay always deep upon it . There were a few regrettable seconds in every minute [she]115-sarah brown lived , [I]573-cully think , though [she]115-sarah brown never enjoyed the compensations attached to a really considerable sin . Anyway [her]115-sarah brown conscience would have been a case for pumice - stone , and when [she]115-sarah brown was happy [she]115-sarah brown always tried to forget it . Yet [she]115-sarah brown was not without a good many very small and unessential resources for sleepless moments . Often [she]115-sarah brown wrote vague comments on matters with which [she]115-sarah brown was not familiar , in an exercise - book , always eventually mislaid . [She]115-sarah brown would awake from dear and unspeakable dreams full of hope , and tell [herself]115-sarah brown stories about [herself]115-sarah brown , trying on various lives and deaths like clothes . [She]121-peony had fine eyes of an absolute grey , and dark hair parted in the middle and drawn down so as to make a triangle of a face which , left to itself , would have been square . " While [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown 's unenviable leisure was spent in acting as slave to [committees]232-committees , [she]115-sarah brown had at the same time a half - time profession which , when [she]115-sarah brown was well enough to follow it , brought twenty shillings a week to [her]115-sarah brown pocket . [She]115-sarah brown was in the habit of sitting every morning in [a small office]1570-a small office , collecting evidence from [charitable spies]1571-charitable spies about [the Naughty Poor]1572-the naughty poor , and , after wrapping the evidence in mysterious ciphers , writing it down very beautifully upon little cards , so that [the next spy]1573-the next spy might have the benefit of all [[his]1573-the next spy forerunners]1574-his forerunners ' experience . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown never thought about the theory of this work , because the different coloured inks and the beautiful writing pleased [her]115-sarah brown so . There are [people to whom a ream of virgin paper is an inspiration , who find the first sharpening of a pencil the most lovable of all labours , who see something almost holy in the dedication of green and red penholders]1575-people to whom a ream of virgin paper is an inspiration , who find the first sharpening of a pencil the most lovable of all labours , who see something almost holy in the dedication of green and red penholders to [their]1575-people to whom a ream of virgin paper is an inspiration , who find the first sharpening of a pencil the most lovable of all labours , who see something almost holy in the dedication of green and red penholders appropriate inks , in whose ears and before whose eyes the alphabet is like a poem or a prayer . Touch on stationery and [you]1576-you touched an insane spot in [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown 's mind . [Her]115-sarah brown dream of a perfect old age was staged in [[a stationer]1577-a stationer 's shop]1578-a stationer 's shop in [a quiet brown street]1579-a quiet brown street ; there [she]115-sarah brown would spend twilit days in stroking thick blotting - paper , in drawing dogs — all looking one way — with new pen - nibs , in giving advice in a hushed voice to [connoisseur customers]1580-connoisseur customers , who should come to buy a diary or a book - plate or a fountain - pen with the same reverence as [they]1575-people to whom a ream of virgin paper is an inspiration , who find the first sharpening of a pencil the most lovable of all labours , who see something almost holy in the dedication of green and red penholders now show who come to buy old wine . Therefore [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown 's hand had found ideal employment on a charity register . As for [her]115-sarah brown mind , it usually shut its eye during office hours . [Her]115-sarah brown Dog [David]124-david liked the work too , as the hearth - rug was a comfortable one , and [Charity]146-charity , though it may suffer long in other directions , is rather particular about its firing . On the Monday after [her]115-sarah brown change of [home]411-home , [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown found that the glory had gone out of the varied inks , and even a new consignment of index - cards , exquisitely unspotted from [the world]275-the world , failed to arouse [her]115-sarah brown enthusiasm . This was partly because the first name in the index that [she]115-sarah brown looked up was that of [Watkins]104-miss watkins , [Thelma Bennett]104-miss watkins , [single , machinist]1583-single , machinist . [The ciphers]1584-the ciphers informed the initiated that [Watkins]104-miss watkins had called on [the War Association]1585-the war association , to ask for Help and Advice , See Full Report . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown felt sad and clumsy , and made two blots , one in green on the [Watkins]104-miss watkins card , and the other in ordinary Stephens - colour on the card of [one Tonk]1586-one tonk , chocolate - box - maker , single , to whom [a certain charity]1587-a certain charity was obstinately giving a half - pint of milk daily , regardless of the fact that last month [she]115-sarah brown had received a shilling's - worth of groceries from [the Parish]1588-the parish . The air of [that office]1589-that office rang with the name of [Tonk]147-tonk that morning . "[152-p] [P. Tonk]153-p. tonk , [unmarried wife]1478-unmarried wife , of [Mitten Island]6-mitten island .... " [The Relieving Officer]1594-the relieving officer went away , for it was dinner - time . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown absently unwrapped the little dinner which [she]115-sarah brown had brought hanging by a thin string from a strangled finger . Mustard sandwiches with just a flavouring of ham , and a painfully orthodox 1918 - model bun , made of stubble . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown almost always forgot the necessity of food until [she]115-sarah brown was irrevocably in the ' bus on [her]115-sarah brown way to work . But this morning , as [she]115-sarah brown had taken [her]115-sarah brown seat with [David]124-david in [the bouncing ferry - boat]1599-the bouncing ferry - boat , there had been a panting rustling noise behind [her]115-sarah brown , and [Harold the Broomstick]117-harold had swept a little packet of sandwiches into [her]115-sarah brown lap . [He]117-harold had disappeared before [she]115-sarah brown had been able to do more than turn over in [her]115-sarah brown mind the question whether or no broomsticks ever expect to be tipped . Now [I]0-i could not say with certainty whether [the witch]432-the witch , in making up this packet of sandwiches , had included the contents of one of [her]432-the witch own little packets of magic . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown would have been very susceptible to such a drug ; [her]115-sarah brown mind was always on the brink of innocent intoxication . Perhaps [she]115-sarah brown was only [half a woman]1601-half a woman , so that half a joy could make [her]115-sarah brown heart reel and sing , and half a sorrow break it . [She]115-sarah brown was defenceless against impressions , and too many impressions make the heart very tired . Therefore , [I]0-i think , [she]115-sarah brown was [a predestined victim of magic]1602-a predestined victim of magic , and it seems unlikely that [the witch]432-the witch should have missed such an opportunity to dispense spells . After the first bite at the first sandwich , [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown was conscious of a Joke somewhere . This feeling in itself was akin to delirium , for there are no two facts so remote as a Joke and a Charity Society . The office table confronted [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown , and [she]115-sarah brown wondered that [she]115-sarah brown could ever have seen it as anything but a butt . [She]115-sarah brown wondered how [she]115-sarah brown had been able to sit daily in front of [that stout and earnest index]1604-that stout and earnest index without poking it in the ribs and making a fool of it . The office clock , alone among clocks , had never played a practical joke . The sad fire below [it]1604-that stout and earnest index , conscious of a Mission , was overloaded with coal and responsibility . The second bite , ten minutes later , caused [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown to be tired and distrustful of [a room that had no smile]1605-a room that had no smile . [Her]115-sarah brown eyes turned to seek the hidden Joke beyond the limits of [that lamentable room]1606-that lamentable room . There was a spring - coloured tree in [the school - ground opposite]1607-the school - ground opposite , and above the tree a rough blue and silver sky contradicted all the doctrines preached in [offices]1608-offices . There was in the wind something of the old raw simplicity and mirth that always haunts [the sea]1556-the sea , and penetrates [inland only]1610-inland only on rare spring days . The high white clouds crossed the sky like galleons , like old stories out of [the innocent Eden]34-the innocent eden - like past of [the sea]1556-the sea , before [she]115-sarah brown learnt the ways of steam and secret killing . Old names of [ships]1612-ships came to [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown 's mind ... [Castle - of - Comfort]35-castle - of - comfort ... Cloud - i'-the - Sun .... "[0-i] [I]0-i am doing wrong , " said [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown . [She]115-sarah brown took a third bite . And then [she]115-sarah brown felt the spirit of [the Naughty Poor]154-the naughty poor in [the room]259-the room ; there was laughter , as of [the registered]1614-the registered , in the ears of [the Registrar]1615-the registrar . It is not really permissible for [the Naughty Poor]1572-the naughty poor to invade offices which exist to do [them]1572-the naughty poor good . The way of charity lies through suspicion , but the suspicion of course must be all on one side . [We]1617-we have to judge [the criminal]1618-the criminal unheard ; if [we]1617-we called [him]1618-the criminal as [a witness]1619-a witness in [his]1618-the criminal case [we]1617-we might become sentimental . [The Charity Society]36-the charity society may be imagined as keeping two lists of crimes , a short one for [Registrars]1620-registrars and [Workers]1621-workers , and a very long one for [the registered]1614-the registered . High on the list of crimes possible to [Registrars]1620-registrars and [Workers]1621-workers is Sentimentality . It is sentimental to feel personal affection for a Case , or to give [a child of the Naughty Poor]1625-a child of the naughty poor a penny without full enquiry , or to say "[0-i] A - goo " to [a grey pensive baby eating dirt on the pavement]1626-a grey pensive baby eating dirt on the pavement , or to acknowledge the right of a Case to ask questions sometimes instead of answering them , or to disapprove of spying and tale - bearing , or to believe any statement made by [any one]1493-any one without an assured income , or to quote any part of the New Testament , or in fact to confuse in any way the ideas of charity and love . [Christ]155-christ , who , by the way , unfortunately omitted to join [any reputable philanthropic society]1628-any reputable philanthropic society , commanded [seekers of salvation]1629-seekers of salvation to be poor and to despise [themselves]1629-seekers of salvation . But this was sentimental , and [the Charity Society]36-the charity society decrees that only [the prosperous]1630-the prosperous and [the self - respectful]1631-the self - respectful shall deserve a hearing . "[0-i] [I]0-i am sentimental , " said [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown to [her]115-sarah brown Dog [David]124-david in a broken voice . [She]115-sarah brown turned again to [her]115-sarah brown enchanted sandwich . There was increased laughter in the air , and through it [she]115-sarah brown heard the hoarse and happy shouting of the sparrows in the spring - coloured tree opposite . [Sparrows]156-sparrows are the ideal [Naughty Poor]154-the naughty poor , [the begging friars]1632-the begging friars , [the gypsies of the air]1633-the gypsies of the air , [they]156-sparrows claim alms as a right and as a seal of friendship ; with [their]156-sparrows mouths full of [your]1634-you crumbs [they]156-sparrows share with [you]1634-you [their]156-sparrows innocent and vulgar wit , [they]156-sparrows give [you]1634-you in return no I.O.U. , and no particulars for [your]1634-you case - paper . When [they]156-sparrows have got from [you]1634-you all that [you]1634-you will give , [they]156-sparrows wink and giggle and shake the dust of [your]1634-you window - sill from off [their]156-sparrows feet . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown opened the office window , and the air of [the office]1635-the office began at once to dance with life and the noise of [children]623-children and birds . [She]115-sarah brown thought perhaps these were magic noises , for [she]115-sarah brown heard them so clearly . [She]115-sarah brown broke [her]115-sarah brown second sandwich upon the window - sill , and the sparrows crossed [the street]329-the street and stood on the area railing in a row below [her]115-sarah brown , all speaking at once in an effort to convey to [her]115-sarah brown the fact that a retreat on [her]115-sarah brown part would be tactful . [The sparrow]1638-the sparrow obviously buys all [his]1638-the sparrow clothes ready - made , probably at Jumble Sales , and [he]1638-the sparrow always seems to choose clothes made for a stouter bird . There is no reason why [he]1638-the sparrow should never look chic ; [he]1638-the sparrow has a slimmer figure than the bullfinch , for instance , who always manages to look so well - tailored . It is just arrogance , pure Londonism , on the part of the sparrow , just that impudent socialistic spirit that makes it so difficult for [us]1639-us to reform [the Naughty Poor]154-the naughty poor . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown retreated one step . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm not going farther away . Either [you]721-you eat that sandwich with [me]0-i looking on , or [you]721-you leave it . " [The sparrows]1640-the sparrows whispered together for a moment , saying to [each other]1641-each other , "[721-you] [You]721-you go first . " [They]1640-the sparrows obviously knew that it was a charity window - sill , and were afraid [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown might intend to rebuke [them]1640-the sparrows for not shutting [their]1640-the sparrows beaks while chewing , or for neglecting to put any crumbs into [the Savings Bank]1642-the savings bank . But after a minute one sparrow moistened [his]1638-the sparrow beak and came .... [He]1638-the sparrow ate , [they]1640-the sparrows all ate , and did not seek to escape as the door of [the office]1635-the office opened and [the witch]432-the witch came in . [She]432-the witch went straight to the window and picked up from among the stooping sparrows a piece of the broken sandwich , and ate it . [The Dog David]124-david was making sure that there was no surviving crumb on the floor to tell the tale of [[his]124-david mother]1645-his mother 's sentimental weakness . Almost instantly , therefore , that sandwich was but a memory , a fading taste in about twenty beaks and two mouths . But still the window stood open , and the air danced , and the white reflections of the ship - like clouds lay on the oilcloth floor . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown in the meanwhile , disregarding [the witch]432-the witch , had returned to the index , and had taken from its drawer a notification form . With reference to the above case , [I]0-i have to report that it seems unsatisfactory . There are indeed grave suspicions that the above name is only an alias , the address being also probably false , for the genuine Charity 's place of origin is said to be [the home]722-the home rather than [the office]1635-the office . [The present registrar]724-the present registrar is at a loss to identify with certainty this case . It would seem to be one of the Habits that haunt [the world]275-the world , collecting Kudos under assumed names .... [I]0-i have noticed that [the girl]1710-the girl 's first love is the monopoly of [the Victorian painter]1711-the victorian painter , whereas [the boy]1712-the boy 's is that of [the novelist]1713-the novelist , but [I]0-i do not know the reason of this . There was a slight clap of thunder and [Richard]164-richard entered . [He]164-richard would have been very obviously [a wizard even without the thunder]1714-a wizard even without the thunder , and seemed much less innocent about [his]164-richard magic than [the witch]432-the witch . [He]164-richard had pale hair , a pale face , and eyes that did not open wide without a certain effort on the part of the brows . "[0-i] [You]787-you are despising [my]0-i ornaments , " [he]164-richard said to [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown . "[0-i] [I]0-i admire them awfully . [I]0-i do n't like really clever art . [Witches]433-witches and [wizards]434-wizards lead difficult lives because [they]1719-they have no ancestry working within [them]1719-they to prompt [them]1719-they in the little details . Whenever [you]1720-you see [a person being unusually grown - up]1721-a person being unusually grown - up , suspect [them]1721-a person being unusually grown - up of magic . [You]1720-you can always notice [witches]433-witches and [wizards]434-wizards , for instance , after eight o'clock at night , pretending that [they]1719-they are not proud of sitting up late . It is all nonsense about [witches]433-witches being night birds ; [they]1719-they often fly about at night , indeed , but only because [they]1719-they are like [permanent children gloriously escaped for ever from [their]1719-they Nanas]1725-permanent children gloriously escaped for ever from their nanas . "[787-you] This picture , " added [Richard]164-richard , "[787-you] seems to [me]0-i very beautiful . " The picture might have cost a shilling originally , framed , or it might have been attached to a calendar once . It was a landscape so thick in colouring and so lightless that it failed to give an outdoor impression at all . There was [a river]1726-a river and waterfall like well - combed hair in the middle , and a dozen leaden mountains lying about with — apparently — pocket - handkerchiefs on their tops , and a dropsical - looking stag drinking . "[787-you] [I]0-i ca n't imagine , " insisted [Richard]164-richard , "[787-you] that there could be a more beautiful picture than that , but perhaps it appeals to [me]0-i specially because [father]788-father and [mother]789-mother and [I]0-i so often talk about the place together — the place like that , near to [the mountain where [I]0-i was born]790-the mountain where i was born . That was in [the Rockies]20-the rockies , [you]791-you know , and just below [[our]792-our mountain]570-our mountain [I]0-i am sure there was [a canyon like that]794-a canyon like that — [I]0-i dream of [it]794-a canyon like that — with milky - green water running under and over and round the most extraordinary shapes of ice , and cactuses like green hedgehogs in the crevices of the rocks , and great untidy pine - trees clinging to an ounce of earth on an inch of flat surface . And the rocks are a most splendid rose - red , and lie in steep layers , and break out into shapes that are so deliberate , they look as if they must mean something . Indeed [they]795-they do .... " [A stave played by a ' cello]1727-a stave played by a ' cello called [them]795-they to supper , and , as [they]795-they returned to [the hall]1728-the hall , a burst of earnest music from the whole orchestra partially drowned the clap of thunder that again marked [Richard]164-richard 's passage through the door . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown felt sure that [Lady Arabel]97-lady arabel arranged this on purpose . [[The wizard]444-the wizard 's mother]1730-the wizard 's mother obviously had great difficulty in not noticing the phenomena connected with [[her]1730-the wizard 's mother son]1731-her son , and [she]1730-the wizard 's mother wore a striving smile and a look of glassy and well - bred unconsciousness whenever anything magic happened . At the end of [the hall]1728-the hall [the orchestra]783-the orchestra , arranged neatly in a crescent , was busily employing [its]783-the orchestra violins in a unanimous melody of so rude and destructive a nature that it seemed as if every string must be broken . This mania spread until even the outlying bassoons , triangles , and celestas were infected . A piercing note of command , however , from a clarinet caused a devastating dumbness to fall suddenly on every instrument except the piano , which continued self - consciously alone . [The pianist]1734-the pianist looked at the ceiling mostly , but one note seemed to be an especial favourite with [him]1734-the pianist , and whenever [he]1734-the pianist played it [he]1734-the pianist looked closely and paternally at it , almost indeed applying [his]1734-the pianist nose to it . All at once , just as [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown was beginning to imagine that [she]115-sarah brown could catch the tune and the time , the music ceased , apparently in the middle of [a bar]1735-a bar . [Richard]164-richard sneezed once or twice . [That unsophisticated wizard]1736-that unsophisticated wizard was evidently enjoying [himself]1736-that unsophisticated wizard in the practice of [his]1736-that unsophisticated wizard art . [One]277-one felt that magic was not encouraged in [the Army]24-the army , and that the supernatural orgy in which [he]1736-that unsophisticated wizard was now indulging was the accumulated reaction after long self - control . Strange noises of unnatural laughter , for instance , proceeded from distant corners of [the hall]1728-the hall , and each of the electric lights in turn winked facetiously . The string of the double bass broke loudly , and the new string which [its devotee]1739-its devotee laboriously inserted also broke at once . [The performer]1740-the performer looked appealingly at [Lady Arabel]97-lady arabel , but [she]97-lady arabel refrained from meeting [his]1740-the performer eye . A blizzard of butterflies enveloped the table . This was evidently rather a difficult trick , for the spell collapsed repeatedly , and from one second to another [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown was never quite sure whether there were really [Purple Admirals]165-purple admirals drowning in [her]97-lady arabel soup or not . "[796-you] [You]796-you are so lucky , " sighed [the witch]432-the witch , "[796-you] plenty of [room]797-room and [every facility]798-every facility . [I]0-i [myself]0-i am so dreadfully cramped and hampered . [I]0-i often have to boil [my]0-i incantations over a spirit lamp , and even that is becoming difficult — no methylated . " "[0-i] Not really lucky , " said [Richard]164-richard . "[0-i] In [France]30-france the smallest pinch of magic seems to make [the N.C.O.]166-the n.c.o. sick , and that 's why [I]0-i never got [my]0-i stripe . To keep [my]0-i hand in , [I]0-i once did a little stunt with [the sergeant]799-the sergeant 's cigarette : it grew suddenly longer as [he]799-the sergeant struck a match to light it , and went on growing till [he]799-the sergeant had to ask [me]0-i to light it for [him]799-the sergeant , and then it shrank up and burnt [his]799-the sergeant nose . Of course [he]799-the sergeant could n't really bring the thing [home]411-home to [me]0-i , but somehow — well , as [I]0-i say , [I]0-i never got [my]0-i stripe . " To this discussion , and indeed to all the enchantments , [Lady Arabel]97-lady arabel paid no attention , but continued to talk a little nervously on very insipid subjects . [Her]97-lady arabel eyes had the pathetic look often seen in [stupid people]1742-stupid people 's eyes , the "[0-i] Don't - listen - to - [me]0-i " look , "[0-i] [I]0-i am not saying what [I]0-i should like to say . The real [Me]0-i is better than this . " Finally [Richard]164-richard indulged in a trick that was evidently a stock joke among [magic people]419-magic people , for [the witch]432-the witch laughed directly it began . Just as [the hostess]1745-the hostess , with poised fork and spoon , was about to distribute the whitebait , the round table began to spin , and the whitebait were whisked away from [her]97-lady arabel . The table continued to spin for a moment , with a deep thrilling organ sound , and when it stopped , the whitebait were found to have assembled opposite to [[Richard]164-richard 's place]1746-richard 's place . [He]164-richard distributed them gravely . [Lady Arabel]97-lady arabel turned scarlet , and murmured to [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown : "[0-i] So dretfully ingenious , and so merry . " [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown took pity on [her]97-lady arabel , and began talking at random . [The orchestra]783-the orchestra was busy again , and to the tune of a loud elusive rag - time , [she]0-i shouted : "[0-i] Do [you]801-you know , [I]0-i gave [my]0-i job the sack this morning . Of such stuff as this is the backbone of [England]59-england made , which is perhaps why the backbone of [England]59-england sometimes seems so sadly inflexible . There was a screeching noise outside , followed by an incredible crash . " The moonlight lay like cream upon the pavement when [the witch]432-the witch and [Harold]117-harold [her]432-the witch broomstick left [[the Higgins]1861-the higgins ' doorstep]1862-the higgins ' doorstep . [The witch]432-the witch , with one soothing hand on the bristling mane of [[her]432-the witch [Harold]117-harold]1885-her harold , lay on [her]432-the witch front on the cloud [she]432-the witch had chosen , and looked down through a little hole in it . It was practically the only cloud present that would have afforded reasonable cover ; the others were mere wisps of sky - weed floating in the moonlight . There was a greater chorus of aeroplanes below [her]432-the witch now ; the whole sky was ringing with it . [The witch]432-the witch could hear a deep bass - voiced machine , a baritone , a quavering tenor , and — thin and sharp as a pin — a little treble sound that made [Harold]117-harold rear and struggle to be free . " [She]432-the witch mounted [her]432-the witch [Harold]117-harold and slipped off the cloud . The guns were shouting now , and the shells wailed and burst not so very far below [them]177-the huns , but [Harold]117-harold trembled no longer . More quickly than a falling star [he]117-harold swooped , and in a second [the alien witch]1888-the alien witch was in sight , an unwieldy figure whose broomstick sounded rather broken - winded , probably owing to the long - distance flight and to the fourteen stone of Teutonic magic on [its]1888-the alien witch back . There was a wicked - looking apparatus attached to the collar of the German broomstick , obviously designed to squirt unpleasant enchantments downward . This contrivance was apparently giving some trouble , for [the German]178-the german was so busy attending to it that at first [she]432-the witch did not see or hear the approach of [Harold]117-harold and [[his]117-harold rider]1889-his rider . [She]432-the witch was aroused to [her]432-the witch danger by a heavy chunk of magic which struck and nearly unseated [her]432-the witch . In a second , however , [she]432-the witch was ready with a parrying enchantment , and the fight began . The two broomsticks reared and circled round [each other]1641-each other , and over and under [each other]1641-each other . From [[their]177-the huns riders]1892-their riders ' finger - tips magic of the most explosive kind crackled , and incantations of such potency were exchanged that , [I]177-the huns am told , the tiles and chimney - pots of [the streets below]1893-the streets below suffered a good deal . Round and round and over and under whirled the broomsticks , till the very spaces went mad , and [London]1-london seemed to rush down [nightmare slopes]1894-nightmare slopes into a stormy sky , while [its]1-london lights swung from pole to pole and were entangled with the stars . [Both broomsticks]1895-both broomsticks were by now so uproariously excited that [neither witch]1896-neither witch was able to aim [her]432-the witch magic missiles very carefully , and indeed it was not long before [Harold]117-harold passed entirely beyond control . After bucking violently once or twice , [he]117-harold gave a wild high cry that was like the wind howling through the fierce forest past of [his]117-harold race , and fell upon the other broomstick , fixing [his]117-harold bristles into its throat . The shock of the collision was too much for [both witches]1897-both witches . But something intervened . The cloud , like a sheep suffering from the lack of other sheep to follow , had not yet quitted the scene . [The witches]1882-the witches ' battle had tended upward , and it had ended several hundred feet above the level of the cloud , which was apparently sinking . [[Our]1922-our witch]1899-our witch , who had good sight , saw that the enemy broomstick was upper - most , and that the writhing [Harold]117-harold was being shaken like a mouse . Magic , as [you]1931-you know , has limitations . Fire is of course a plaything in magic hands . Water has its docile moments , [the earth]1816-the earth herself may be tampered with , and an incantation may call [man]1933-man or any of [his]1933-man possessions to attention . But space is too great a thing , space is the inconceivable Hand , holding aloft this fragile delusion that is [[our]1922-our world]1934-our world . There is no power that can mock at space , there is no enchantment that is not lost between [us]1922-our and [the moon]1935-the moon , and [all magic people]1936-all magic people know — and tremble to know — that in a breath , between one second and another , that Hand may close , and the shell of time first crack and then be crushed , and magic be one with nothingness and death and all other delusions . This is why magic , which treats the other elements as its servants , bows before space , and has to call such a purely independent contrivance as a broomstick to its help in the matter of air - travel . [The witches]1882-the witches faced each other on [[their]1882-the witches little unstable sanctuary in [the kingdom of space]1939-the kingdom of space]1938-their little unstable sanctuary in the kingdom of space . [Our witch]1899-our witch 's mind overflowed with the thought of invasions and the coming in of tides . [The English witch]1964-the english witch looked down , singing a little to keep up [her]1964-the english witch morale . [London]1-london looked exactly like the maps [you]1965-you buy for sixpence from [sad - looking gentlemen in [the Strand]1967-the strand]1966-sad - looking gentlemen in the strand , only [it]1-london was sown with a thin crop of lights , and was chiefly designed in grey and darker grey , and the Tubes did not show so indecently . With surprising clearness the rhythmic whispering of [the trains]1968-the trains and the scanty traffic could be heard , and once even the shrill characteristic voice of [an ambulance]1969-an ambulance . Somehow space did not seem disturbed by these sounds ; its quietness pressed upon [the listeners]1970-the listeners ' minds like a heavy dream , and there was no real believing in anything but space . [[Our]1971-our witch]1899-our witch felt [she]1914-the german could have smudged [London]1-london off the face of space with [her]1914-the german finger , and the thought of seven million lives involved in the fate of that sliding chart carried no conviction to [her]1914-the german . [She]1914-the german forced into [her]1914-the german mind the realisation of humanity , and of [little lives]1973-little lives lived in [little rooms]1974-little rooms . "[905-she] As [one Crusader]913-one crusader to another , " [she]1914-the german said , "[913-one crusader] do [you]914-you find it does much good in the war against Evil to drop bombs on [people]357-people in [[their]357-people homes]916-their homes ? After all , [every baby]917-every baby is good in bed , and even [soldiers when on leave]918-soldiers when on leave are anti - militarist . " "[918-soldiers when on leave] It always does good to exterminate vermin in [[their]919-their lair]920-their lair , " said [the German]1914-the german , trying restlessly to raise [herself]1914-the german more to the level of [[her]1914-the german lighter companion]1976-her lighter companion , who was still perched [on the surface of the cloud]1977-on the surface of the cloud . "[918-soldiers when on leave] It is at [home]411-home that Evil is originated , it is at [home]411-home that [English women]923-english women conceive and bear [a new generation of [enemies of the Right]925-enemies of the right]924-a new generation of enemies of the right , it is at [home]411-home that [English children]927-english children are bred up in [their]927-english children marauding ways . " The cloud was very small now . The filmy edges of it were faintly rising and falling like the seaweed frill of a rock in [the sea]1556-the sea . [The witch]432-the witch kept [her]432-the witch eyes on [[her]432-the witch opponent]1945-her opponent 's face , because to look anywhere else gave [her]432-the witch a white feeling in [her]432-the witch head . "[0-i] [[My]0-i wizard]946-my wizard fell at [Vimy Ridge]67-vimy ridge .... " "[0-i] [You]0-i are talking magic at last , " said [[our]944-we witch]1899-our witch . How can [two people]950-two people be righteously scourging [each other]1641-each other at the same time ? It is like the old problem of two serpents eating each other , starting at the tail . There must be some misunderstanding somewhere . Or else some real Evil somewhere . " "[952-you] There is , " said [the German]1914-the german , recovering [herself]1914-the german . "[952-you] [England]59-england is Evil . [England]59-england is the World Enemy . Throughout the ages [she]59-england has been the Robber State , crushing — — " But [she]59-england had little luck . Once more [she]59-england was interrupted by an explosion , a much louder one , directly above [them]950-two people . [[Our]944-we witch]1899-our witch hardly heard the noise ; [she]59-england seemed suddenly to have found the climax of [her]59-england life , and the climax was pain . There was pain and a feeling of terrible change all over [her]59-england , smothering [her]59-england , and a super - pain in [her]59-england shoulder . After a second or two as long as death , [she]59-england realised dimly that [she]59-england was all tensely strung to an attitude , like a marionette . [Her]59-england hands were up trying to shield [her]59-england head , [her]59-england chin was pressed down to [her]59-england drawn - up knees . [Her]59-england blue serge shoulder was extraordinarily wet and immovable . [She]59-england looked along the cloud . [[Her]59-england enemy]1907-her enemy was not there . There was a round hole in the cloud , and as [she]59-england leaned painfully towards it , [she]59-england could see a few of the lights of [London]1-london , and something falling spasmodically towards [them]1988-them . The cloud had been shaken to its foundations by the two explosions , and [the German witch , who had been seated perhaps on a seam in the material , or at any rate on one of the less stable parts of the fabric]1989-the german witch , who had been seated perhaps on a seam in the material , or at any rate on one of the less stable parts of the fabric , had fallen through . [Her]59-england parachute cloak , in passing through the hole in the cloud , had been turned inside out above [her]59-england head , and rendered useless . Over and about [her]59-england falling figure [her]59-england broomstick darted helplessly , uttering curious sad cries , like a seagull 's . Even as [the English witch]1964-the english witch watched [[her]59-england enemy]1907-her enemy 's disaster , the larger part of the cloud , weakened by all the shock and movement , broke away with a hissing sound . [The witch]432-the witch 's feet hung now over space , [she]59-england dared not move ; [she]59-england had difficulty in steadying [herself]59-england with [her]59-england unwounded arm , for [her]59-england hand could find only a quicksand of dissolving cloud to lean on . [She]59-england had no thoughts left but thoughts of danger and of pain . But [Harold the Broomstick]117-harold came back . [The witch]432-the witch heard a rustling sound close to [her]59-england , and it startled [her]59-england more than all the noise of the guns , which had come , as it seemed , from the forgotten other side of eternity . The rough head of [Harold]117-harold appeared over [the cloud 's edge]1994-the cloud 's edge , and insinuated itself pathetically under [her]59-england arm . Very carefully and very painfully [the witch]432-the witch reached a kneeling position , damaging [her]59-england refuge with every movement in spite of [her]59-england care . [She]432-the witch gasped with pain , and [Harold]117-harold tried to look very strong and hopeful to comfort [her]432-the witch . [He]117-harold straightened [his]117-harold back , and [she]432-the witch crawled into the saddle . The tremor of [their]1996-they launching split the cloud into several parts , which disintegrated . There was no more foot - hold on it ; the tide had come up and submerged it . [Harold the Broomstick]117-harold was crippled , [he]117-harold stumbled as [he]117-harold flew , sometimes [he]117-harold dropped a score of feet , and span . [He]117-harold did stunts by mistake . [They]1996-they had not strength enough between [them]1996-they to get [home]411-home . [They]1996-they made a forced landing in [the silver loneliness of [Kensington Gardens]68-kensington gardens]1998-the silver loneliness of kensington gardens . It was [a fortunate place]1999-a fortunate place , for there is much magic there . Wherever there are [children who pretend]2000-children who pretend , there grows a little magic in the air , and therefore the wind of [Kensington Gardens]68-kensington gardens thrills with enchantment , and [the Round Pond]2001-the round pond , full of much pretence of great Armadas , crossed and re - crossed with the abiding wakes of ships full of treasure and romance , is [a blessed lake to [magic people]419-magic people]2002-a blessed lake to magic people . [The witch]432-the witch bathed [Harold]117-harold , [her]432-the witch broomstick , in [the Round Pond]69-the round pond . [He]117-harold evidently felt its healing quality at once , for after the first minute of immersion , [he]117-harold swam about exultantly , and shook drops full of moonlight out of [his]117-harold mane . The bugles sounded All - clear in many keys all round the ear 's horizon ; their sound matched the waning moonlight . [The witch]432-the witch bathed [her]432-the witch shoulder , and then [she]432-the witch found [her]432-the witch way to [a little quiet place [she]432-the witch knew of]2006-a little quiet place she knew of , where [no park - keeper]2007-no park - keeper ever looks , [a place where secret and ungardened daffodils grow in springtime]2008-a place where secret and ungardened daffodils grow in springtime , [a place where all the mice and birds play unafraid , because no cat can find the way thither]2009-a place where all the mice and birds play unafraid , because no cat can find the way thither . [You]2010-you can see [the Serpentine]70-the serpentine from [that place]2011-that place , and the bronze shadows under [its]70-the serpentine bridge , but no [houses]2012-houses , and no railways , and no signs of [London]1-london . Here [the witch]432-the witch made a little fire , and leaned three sticks together over it ; [she]432-the witch lighted the fire with [her]432-the witch finger - tip and hung over it the little patent folding cauldron , which [she]432-the witch always carried on a chatelaine swinging from [her]432-the witch belt . And [she]432-the witch made a charm of daisy - heads , and spring - smelling grasses , and the roots of unappreciated weeds , and the mosses that cover [the tiny faery cliffs of [the Serpentine]70-the serpentine]2014-the tiny faery cliffs of the serpentine . Over the mixture [she]432-the witch shook out the contents of one of [her]432-the witch little paper packets of magic . All this [she]432-the witch boiled over [her]432-the witch fire for many hours , sitting beside it in the silver darkness , with [her]432-the witch knees drawn up and [her]432-the witch hands clasped in front of them . The trees sprang up into the moonlight like dark fountains from the pools of their own shadows . Little shreds of cloud flowed wonderfully across the sky . There was no sound except the sound of the water , like an uncertain player upon a little instrument . The charm was still unfinished when the dawn passed over [London]1-london , and the sun came up , the seed of another day , sown in a rich red soil . [The trees of [the Gardens]2016-the gardens]2015-the trees of the gardens remembered [their]2015-the trees of the gardens daylight shadows again , and forgot [their]2015-the trees of the gardens mystery . There seemed a veil of mist and bird - song over [the world]275-the world . The sudden song of the birds was like finding the hearing of one 's heart restored , after long deafness . [The witch]432-the witch anointed [her]432-the witch shoulder with the charm , after having first made a drop of potion out of the bubbles in it . This potion [she]432-the witch drank , and was healed of [her]432-the witch wound and [her]432-the witch weariness , and of all desires except a desire to sleep with [her]432-the witch face among the daffodils . " The night was by then far from young , in fact it was well into its second childhood . But [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown and [the Dog David]124-david sought and tried on land outfits for several hours . [The shop]406-the shop was divided into three horizontal departments . Nearest the floor were the foodstuffs ; biscuit tins buttressed the counter on every side ; regiments of Grape - nuts , officered by an occasional Quaker Oat , stood in review order all round the lower shelves . On the counter little castles of tinned fruit were built , while bins beneath [it]2034-it held the varied grain , cereal , and magic stock . About on a level with one 's head [the hardware department]2035-the hardware department began : frying - pans lolled with tin coffee - pots over racks , dust - pans divorced from [their]2036-their brushes were platonically attached to flat - irons or pie - dishes , [Stephen]184-stephen 's Inks were allied with penny mugs or tins of boot polish in an invasion of the middle shelves , and a wreath of sponges crowned the champion of a row of kettles in shining armour . Against the ceiling the drapery section was found . Overalls , ready - made breeches , [babies]2037-babies ' socks , and pink flannelette mysteries hung doubled up as if in pain over strings nailed to the rafters . From [this department]2038-this department [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown , balanced upon three large biscuit tins placed on the counter , chose [her]115-sarah brown outfit with vanity and care . The general effect was not good , but [she]115-sarah brown did not know this , for [she]115-sarah brown studied the parts separately in a six - inch mirror . [She]115-sarah brown was filled with a simple pleasure . For [she]115-sarah brown was always absurdly moved by little excitements , and by any prospect of a changed to - morrow . [She]115-sarah brown was not really used to being alive at all , and that is what made [her]115-sarah brown take to magic so kindly . "[432-the witch] In six hours , " [she]115-sarah brown said , "[0-i] [I]0-i shall be on [my]0-i way to something utterly new . The rabbits can never be caught in [this land]2040-this land of happy animals , but [they]2041-they give good sport and always play fair . [David Blessing Brown]185-david , [a dog of independent yet loving habit]2042-a dog of independent yet loving habit , had spent about four - fifths of [his]185-david life in [the Brown family]2043-the brown family . [He]185-david was three years old , and though ineligible for military service , made a point of wearing khaki about [his]185-david face , and in a symmetrical heart - shaped spot near [his]185-david tail . To [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown [he]185-david was the Question and the Answer , [his]185-david presence was a constant playtime for [her]115-sarah brown mind ; so well was [he]185-david loved that [he]185-david seemed to [her]115-sarah brown to move in a little mist and clamour of love . With every one else [she]115-sarah brown held but lame intercourse , but [her]115-sarah brown Dog [David]124-david and [she]115-sarah brown withheld no passing thought from [each other]1641-each other . [They]1641-each other could often be heard by [unmattering landladies]2045-unmattering landladies and [passers - by]2046-passers - by exchanging views in the strong Suffolk accent that was a sort of standing joke between [them]1641-each other . [I]964-the foreman believe that [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown had loved [the Dog David]124-david so much that [she]115-sarah brown had given [him]124-david a soul . Certainly other dogs did not care for [him]124-david . [David]124-david said that [they]1641-each other had found out that [his]124-david second name was [Blessing]185-david , and that [they]1641-each other laughed at [him]124-david for it . [His]124-david face was seamed with the scars of [their]1641-each other laughing . But [I]964-the foreman know that the enmity had a more fundamental reason than that . [I]964-the foreman know that when [men]483-men speak with the tongues of [angels]282-angels [they]483-men are shunned and hated by [men]483-men , and so [I]964-the foreman think that when dogs approach humanity too nearly [they]483-men are banished from the love of [their]483-men own kind . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown was not altogether unfamiliar with the Parish of Faery , but [she]115-sarah brown never failed to be surprised by the enchantment of [the Enchanted Forest]72-the enchanted forest . [The Green Ride]80-the green ride runs straight through [it]72-the enchanted forest , so incredibly straight that as [you]2050-you walk along [it]72-the enchanted forest the end of it is at the end of [your]2050-you sight , and is like a star in a green sky . There is a dream that binds [your]2050-you mind as [you]2050-you cross [the forest]2051-the forest ; it is like an imitation of eternity , so that , as [you]2050-you pass into [the forest]2051-the forest 's shade , time passes from before [you]2050-you , and , as [you]2050-you pass out of it , [you]2050-you seem to have lived a thousand quiet and utterly forgotten lives . Clocks and calendars have no meaning in [the forest]2051-the forest ; the seasons and the hours haunt it at [their]483-men will , and abide by no law . Just as the sun upon a stormy day makes golden [a moving and elusive acre]2054-a moving and elusive acre in [[our]2055-our human woods]2056-our human woods , so the night in [the Enchanted Forest]813-the enchanted forest comes and goes like a ghost upon the sight of [lovers of the night]2058-lovers of the night . For there [you]2050-you may step , unastonished , from the end of a day into its beginning ; there the summer and the winter may dodge each other round one tree ; there [you]2050-you may see at one glance a spring hoar frost and an autumn trembling of airs , a wild cherry tree blossoming beside a tawny maple . [The forest]2051-the forest is so deep and so thick that [it]2051-the forest provides its own sky , and can enjoy its own impulses , and [its]2051-the forest own quiet anarchy . There [you]2050-you forget that sky of ours across whose face some tyrant drives [our]2055-our few docile seasons in conventional order . [I]964-the foreman think [the Dog David]124-david in [his]124-david own way shared the dream that leads [wayfarers]2060-wayfarers through [the Enchanted Forest]72-the enchanted forest . When [he]124-david came out with [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown under the tasselled arch of [Travellers]186-travellers ' Joy that crosses [the end of [the Green Ride]812-the green ride]2061-the end of the green ride , [he]124-david was all shining and dewy with adventure , and [his]124-david tail was upright , as though [he]124-david were pretending that it carried a flag . On an abrupt hill in the middle of [an enormous green meadow [a Castle]2064-a castle]2063-an enormous green meadow a castle stood , just as [Richard]164-richard had predicted . It was To [Let]74-let , and was not looking its best . [Some man of enterprise]2065-some man of enterprise , taking advantage of [its]2064-a castle forlorn condition , had glued an advertisement upon [[its]2064-a castle donjon keep]2066-its donjon keep . [You]2067-you could almost have measured that advertisement in [acres]2068-acres ; it recommended a face cream , and represented [a lady with a face of horrible size , whose naturally immaculate complexion was marred by the rivets and loopholes of the donjon keep itself , which protruded in rather a distressing way]2069-a lady with a face of horrible size , whose naturally immaculate complexion was marred by the rivets and loopholes of the donjon keep itself , which protruded in rather a distressing way . Oak trees stood round the foot of [that pale hill]2070-that pale hill , and the general effect was rather that of parsley round a ham . Between two oaks [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown , following directions , found the beginning of [the Daisified Path]821-the daisified path . There were not only daisies all over [the path]2072-the path but real violets on either side of [it]2072-the path . [The daisies]2073-the daisies looked one in the face , but [the violets]2074-the violets did not , because [they]2074-the violets had morbidly bad manners . Still of course manners are very small change and count for very little ; the violet , being [an artist]2075-an artist , is entitled to any manners [it]2075-an artist likes , while the daisy has no temperament whatever , and no excuse for eccentricity . Grasshoppers tatted industriously and impartially among the daisies and [the violets]2074-the violets . Here outside [the forest]2051-the forest there was weather again , and the weather was more promising than generous . [It]2064-a castle continued to promise all day without exactly explaining what [its]2064-a castle promise was , and without achieving any special fulfilment . Fine silver lines of sunlight were ruled at a steep angle across a grey slate view . At the gate of [Higgins Farm]55-higgins farm , [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown was a little disconcerted to find a small dragon . It was coiled round a tree beside [the clipped box archway]2078-the clipped box archway . It was not a very fine specimen , being of a brownish - green colour , and having lost the tip of one wing . Its spine was serrated , especially deeply between its shoulder blades , where it could raise a sort of crest if angered or excited . But at present it was asleep , its saturnine and rather wistful face rested upon one scaly paw . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown was uncertain what to do , but the Dog [David]124-david took the matter into [his]124-david own paws by mistake . [He]124-david had just met one of the castle dogs , one of those tremulous - tailed creatures who spend [themselves]2079-themselves in a rather pathetic effort to sustain an imaginary reputation for humour . [David]124-david retorted to this dog 's first facetious onslaught with a kindly quip , [they]2080-they trod on each other once or twice with extravagant gestures , and then parted hysterically , each supposing [himself]124-david to be pursued by [the other]424-the other . It was then that [David]124-david tripped over the dragon 's barbed tail . [David]124-david squeaked , and the dragon awoke . [It]2082-it uncoiled itself suddenly like a broken spring . "[964-the foreman] Gosh , " it said . "[964-the foreman] Asleep again ! [I]0-i was waiting for [you]963-you , and the sun on [my]0-i back always makes [me]0-i sleepy . [I]0-i am [the foreman]964-the foreman . [Higgins]164-richard telephoned that [you]963-you were coming . " [It]2082-it preceded [her]963-you through [the little green archway that led to [the farm]2084-the farm]2083-the little green archway that led to the farm . [She]963-you followed . On the other side of the archway the whole view of [the plain called [Higgins Farm]55-higgins farm]2087-the plain called higgins farm met [the adventurer]2088-the adventurer . [The farm - buildings]2089-the farm - buildings were heaped graciously together on a little wave in the sea of [ploughed fields]2090-ploughed fields . Except for two pale ricks in [their]2089-the farm - buildings midst , [they]2089-the farm - buildings exactly matched [their]2089-the farm - buildings surroundings , [they]2089-the farm - buildings were plastered dark red , and thatched with very old green and brown thatch . Beyond [the buildings]2091-the buildings was a little wood , [its]2092-its interior lighted up with bluebells , and [this wood]2093-this wood merged into [an orchard]2094-an orchard , where a white pony and an auburn pig strove apparently to eat the same blade of grass . [The various sections of [the farm land]2096-the farm land]2095-the various sections of the farm land lay mapped out in different intensities of brown , very young green , and maturer green , and [each section]2097-each section was dotted with [people]357-people . [They]357-people seemed [small people]2099-small people even from a distance , and , as [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown advanced at the tail of the dragon , [she]115-sarah brown saw that [the workers]2100-the workers were all indeed under ordinary human size . The tallest , [a man guiding a miniature plough behind a tall horse]2101-a man guiding a miniature plough behind a tall horse , might have reached [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown 's shoulder . [None of [them]2100-the workers]2102-none of them seemed hard at work , [they]2100-the workers stood talking in little groups . " [They]980-they reached a part of [a field in which broad beans were enjoying an innocent childhood among white butterflies]2112-a field in which broad beans were enjoying an innocent childhood among white butterflies . " [David]124-david sat uncomfortably on a broad bean , protesting against this new mania . For a moment [he]124-david had thought that [she]115-sarah brown was seeking for a mouse with some patent mouse - finding implement . [He]124-david had even tried to help [her]115-sarah brown , and turned over a clod with a critical paw , but one sniff had showed [him]124-david the empty futility of the thing . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown hoed rather happily for a couple of hours , and then [she]115-sarah brown began to count the beans still waiting trustfully in the queue , waiting to be attended to and freed from [their]983-they embarrassments . There were ninety - six , [she]115-sarah brown decided , standing up ostensibly to greet [an aeroplane]2116-an aeroplane . [She]115-sarah brown became very glad of the occasional aeroplanes that crossed above [[her]115-sarah brown field]2117-her field , and gave [her]115-sarah brown an excuse for standing with a straight back to watch [them]2116-an aeroplane . [Aeroplanes]2118-aeroplanes , crossing singly or in [wild - bird formations]2119-wild - bird formations , are so common in the sky of [Faery]189-faery that every one in those parts , while turning [his]2120-his own eyes inevitably upwards , secretly thinks [[his]2120-his neighbour]2121-his neighbour lamentably rustic and unsophisticated for looking at them . [Every aeroplane that crosses [Faery]189-faery]2122-every aeroplane that crosses faery feels , [I]986-the shropshire lad suppose , the reflected magic from [the land below]2123-the land below , for there is never one with the barest minute to spare that does not pause and try to be clever over [Higgins Farm]55-higgins farm . [You]2124-you may see one industriously climbing the clouds over [the Enchanted Forest]72-the enchanted forest , evidently trying hard to be intent on its destination . [You]2124-you may see it falter , struggling with its sense of duty , and then break weakly into a mild figure eight . [The ragged rooks of Faery]2125-the ragged rooks of faery at once hurry into the air to show [their]2125-the ragged rooks of faery laborious imitator how this should be done . The spirit of frivolous competition enters into [the aeroplane]2126-the aeroplane , its duty is flung to the winds . [It]0-i flaunts itself up and down once or twice , as if to say : "[986-the shropshire lad] Now look , [everybody]289-everybody , [I]0-i 'm going to be clever . " Then it goes mad . [It]0-i leaps upon [imaginary Boches]190-imaginary boches , it stands upon [its]0-i head and falls downward until the very butterflies begin to take cover , it stands upon its tail and falls upward , it writes messages in a flowing hand across the sky and returns to cross the t 's . It circles impertinently round [your]2124-you head , fixing its bold tricolour eye upon [you]2124-you until [you]2124-you begin to think there must be something wrong with [your]2124-you appearance . It bounds upon a field of onions and rebounds in the same breath from the topmost cloud of heaven . [The rooks]2127-the rooks return disconsolately to [[their]2127-the rooks nests]2128-their nests . Then [you]2124-you may see the erring machine suddenly remember itself , and check itself in the act of some new paroxysm . [It]0-i remembers the European War that gave [it]0-i birth ; [it]0-i thinks of [[its]0-i mates]2129-its mates scanning the sky for its coming ; its frivolity ebbs suddenly . The eastern sky becomes once more its highway instead of [its]0-i trapeze . [It]0-i collects its wits , emits a few contrite bubbles of smoke , and leaps beyond sight . Whenever this happened , [the female fairies]2130-the female fairies behaved in a very plebeian and forward manner , waving [their]2130-the female fairies hoes at [each machine]2131-each machine , encouraging [it]0-i by brazen gestures to further extravagances , and striving to reach its hearing with loud shrill cries . There was very little difference between [these fairies]2132-these fairies and [other lady war - workers]2133-other lady war - workers . In fact [they]2132-these fairies were only distinguishable by [their]2132-these fairies stature and by the empty and innocent expression of [their]2132-these fairies faces . Also perhaps by [their]2132-these fairies tuneful singing , and by a habit of breaking out suddenly into country dances between the bean - rows . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown , who worked a great deal more industriously than [any one else in sight]2134-any one else in sight , soon overtook [them]2132-these fairies , and while conscious of that touch of interested scorn always felt by [the One]2135-the one towards [the Herd]191-the herd , found relief in watching [their]2132-these fairies vagaries , and presently in speaking to [them]2132-these fairies . For [she]115-sarah brown needed relief , poor [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown , [her]115-sarah brown disabilities were catching [her]115-sarah brown up ; a hoarse contralto cough was reminding [her]115-sarah brown of [many doctors]2136-many doctors ' warnings against manual work . [She]115-sarah brown could feel , so to speak , the distant approaching tramp of that pain in [her]115-sarah brown side under whose threat [she]115-sarah brown had lived all [her]115-sarah brown life . But there were seventy - five beans yet . The note of [her]115-sarah brown hoe , a high note not quite true pitched , clamoured monotonously upon [her]115-sarah brown brain . Three blisters and a half were persecuting [her]115-sarah brown hands . "[0-i] Let them blist , " [she]115-sarah brown said defiantly . "[0-i] This row of beans was given [me]0-i to hoe , and Death itself shall not take it from [me]0-i . " [She]115-sarah brown could almost imagine [she]115-sarah brown saw [Death]192-death , waiting for [her]115-sarah brown tactfully beyond the last bean . [She]115-sarah brown had no sense of proportion . [She]115-sarah brown was so very weary of having [her]115-sarah brown life interrupted by [her]115-sarah brown weakness that anything that [she]115-sarah brown had begun to do always seemed to [her]115-sarah brown worth finishing , even under torture . To finish every task , in spite of all hindrance , was [her]115-sarah brown only ambition , but it was almost always frustrated . Seventy more beans . "[0-i] Three score and ten , " thought [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown . "[0-i] What 's that ? Only a lifetime . " [She]115-sarah brown bent to [her]115-sarah brown work . A great clump of buttercups bestrode [her]115-sarah brown bean row , and as after a struggle [she]115-sarah brown dragged its protesting roots from the earth , something fell from it . "[0-i] Oh , a nest , " [she]115-sarah brown gasped . "[0-i] Look , [I]0-i have hoed up a nest . " "[0-i] Good gracious , " exclaimed [a fairy]1366-a fairy . "[0-i] Look what [she]988-she 's done . [[Clement]193-clement 's nest]989-clement 's nest was really almost more than semi - detached . It had been but lightly wedged between two buttercup stalks . " [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown , with a deep sigh , began hoeing again . Fifty beans yet . [She]115-sarah brown had altogether ceased to find pleasure in the day . Pain is an extinguisher that can put out the sun . [She]115-sarah brown had ceased to find pleasure in the singing of the birds , the voice of the pigeon sounded to [her]115-sarah brown no more than an unbeautiful falsetto growl . [She]115-sarah brown was irritated by the fact that the cuckoo had only one song to sing . [She]115-sarah brown tried not to hoe in time to that song , but the monotony of it possessed [her]115-sarah brown . [Her]115-sarah brown row of beans stretched in front of [her]115-sarah brown right across [the world]275-the world ; every time [she]115-sarah brown looked along [it]2144-it the end seemed farther away . Every time [she]115-sarah brown raised [her]115-sarah brown hoe the sword of pain slipped under [her]115-sarah brown guard . [The Dog David]124-david , impatient of [her]115-sarah brown unnatural taste in occupations , had forsaken [her]115-sarah brown . [She]115-sarah brown could trace [his]124-david course by a moving ripple across [the potato patch]2145-the potato patch , just as a shark 's movement seams [the sea]1556-the sea . Forty beans . Time wears a strangely different guise out of doors . Under the sun time stands almost still . Only when every minute is a physical effort do [you]2147-you discover that there really are sixty minutes in an hour , and that one hour is very little nearer to the evening than another . [People who work indoors under the government of clocks]2148-people who work indoors under the government of clocks never meet time face to face . [Their]2148-people who work indoors under the government of clocks quick seconds are dismissed by the clicking of typewriters , and when [their]2148-people who work indoors under the government of clocks typewriters fall silent , [their]2148-people who work indoors under the government of clocks day is over . [[We]2149-we of Out of [Doors]78-doors]2150-we of out of doors have a daily eternity to contend with during which only [our]2149-we hands are busy ; [our]2149-we minds may grow old and young again between sunrise and sunset ; the future may be remade in an hour , hope killed and reborn before a blackbird 's song is over . [We]2149-we know the length of days . And after many slow months of stress [we]2149-we come back again , old and bewildered with much silence and much wondering , to [[our]2149-we friends]2151-our friends in [offices]1608-offices , and find [them]2151-our friends unchanged , floating innocently on the surface of time . "[0-i] There are twenty - five more beans , but [I]0-i ca n't hoe them . " "[0-i] Why should [you]0-i ? " asked [the nearest fairy]2139-the nearest fairy indifferently . [The dragon]2105-the dragon undulated up [the field]2161-the field .
