Having [your]999-your dinner ? Quite right too . " [He]2105-the dragon never noticed the twenty - five unhoed beans . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown sat on the edge of [a shore of green shadow]2163-a shore of green shadow , and a sea of sun speckled with buttercups was before [her]115-sarah brown . [David Blessing]185-david came and leaned against [her]115-sarah brown . [His]185-david first intentions were good , [he]185-david kissed [her]115-sarah brown hurriedly on the chin , but after that [he]185-david kissed the sandwich bag . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown wondered whether [she]115-sarah brown could cut [her]115-sarah brown throat with a hoe . "[1000-the said mind] Suicide while of sound mind , " [she]115-sarah brown said . "[1000-the said mind] [The said mind]1000-the said mind being entirely sick of [its]1000-the said mind unsound body . " If [she]115-sarah brown sat absolutely still and upright the pain was bearable . But even to think of movement brought tears of pain to [her]115-sarah brown eyes . [She]115-sarah brown detached [her]115-sarah brown mind from [her]115-sarah brown predicament , and sank into a warm tropical sea of thought . [She]115-sarah brown was [no real thinker]2164-no real thinker , but [she]115-sarah brown thought much about thinking , and was passionately interested in watching [her]115-sarah brown own mind at work . Thought was like sleep to [her]115-sarah brown , [she]115-sarah brown sank deeply into it without reaching anything profound , nothing resulted but useless dreams , and a certain comforting and defiant intimacy with [herself]115-sarah brown . [She]115-sarah brown thought of [Richard]164-richard , and wished that [she]115-sarah brown could have hoed a blessing into every bean of [his]164-richard that [she]115-sarah brown had hoed . [She]115-sarah brown noted half - consciously and without surprise that the thought of [him]164-richard was beautiful to [her]115-sarah brown . [She]115-sarah brown could not conjure up [his]164-richard face before [her]115-sarah brown mind , because [she]115-sarah brown always forgot realities , and only remembered dreams . [She]115-sarah brown could not imagine the sound of [his]164-richard voice , [she]115-sarah brown could not recall anything that [he]164-richard had said . Yet [she]115-sarah brown felt again the magic feeling of meeting [him]164-richard , and dreamt of all the things that might have happened , and that might yet happen , yet never would happen , between [him]164-richard and [her]115-sarah brown . All the best things that [she]115-sarah brown remembered had only happened in [her]115-sarah brown dreams , [her]115-sarah brown imagination no sooner sipped the first sip of an experience than it conjured up for [her]115-sarah brown great absurd satisfying draughts of nectar , for which the waking [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown might thirst in vain . But there was no waking [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown . [Her]115-sarah brown life was only a sleep - walking ; only very rarely did [she]115-sarah brown awake for a moment and feel ashamed to see how alert was the world about [her]115-sarah brown . So [she]115-sarah brown thought of [Richard]164-richard , not of [Richard]164-richard 's Richard , but of [some pale private Richard of [her]115-sarah brown own]2165-some pale private richard of her own . The approach of [Richard]164-richard upon a white horse for some time seemed only an extension of [her]115-sarah brown dream . It was only when [she]115-sarah brown realised that [he]164-richard was riding up [her]115-sarah brown bean - row , and partially undoing the work of [her]115-sarah brown hoe , that [she]115-sarah brown awoke suddenly with a start , and caught and tore [her]115-sarah brown breath upon a pin of pain . It seemed that the afternoon had now long possessed [the fields]2166-the fields , it had wakened into a live and electric blue [the Enchanted Forest which [she]115-sarah brown had last noticed shimmering in [its]2167-the enchanted forest which she had last noticed shimmering in its noon green noon green]2167-the enchanted forest which she had last noticed shimmering in its noon green . [All the workers at the approach of]2168-all the workers at the approach of [Richard]164-richard were working busily , bent ostentatiously in the form of hairpins up and down [their]2168-all the workers at the approach of rows . [The dragon]2105-the dragon was rippling anxiously along at the heels of the white horse ; a helpless hoping for the best expressed itself in every spike along [his]164-richard spine . "[1000-the said mind] [I]0-i do n't really know why [she]1001-she 's idling like that , " [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown heard [him]164-richard say in [his]164-richard breathy pathetic voice . "[0-i] [I]0-i left [her]1001-she hard at work . [They]1002-they 're all the same when [my]0-i back 's turned . [A fellow]979-a fellow needs to have eyes at the tip of [his]979-a fellow tail . " "[979-a fellow] Are [you]0-i suffering from that [Leverhulme]195-leverhulme six - hour - working - day sort of feeling ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i was meditating suicide , " replied [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown candidly , if faintly . " "[0-i] Ah , give it to [me]0-i . Give it to [me]0-i , " said [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown . The pain was like a wave breaking upon [her]115-sarah brown , carrying [her]115-sarah brown away from [[her]115-sarah brown safe shore of shadow]2170-her safe shore of shadow , to be lost in [seething and suffocating seas]2171-seething and suffocating seas without rest . [Her]115-sarah brown eyes felt dried up with fever , and whenever [she]115-sarah brown shut them , the darkness was filled with a jumble of nauseating squares in blue upon a mustard - coloured background . The smell of beans was terrible . [Richard]164-richard fumbled with something very badly folded up in newspaper . [He]164-richard also tried ineffectively to light a match by wiping it helplessly against [his]164-richard riding breeches . [He]164-richard seemed to have none of the small skill in details that comes to [most people]1425-most people before [they]1425-most people grow up . [He]164-richard did everything as if [he]164-richard were doing it for the first time . "[0-i] [I]0-i had nothing but the Morning Post to wrap it in , " [he]164-richard murmured . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm afraid that may have spoilt the magic a little . " It was the dragon finally who produced the necessary light . After watching [Richard]164-richard with the anxious sympathy of one ineffectual for another , it said : "[0-i] Let [me]0-i , " and kindly breathed out a little flame , which set the packet aflare for a moment . The ashes fluttered down from [Richard]164-richard 's hand among the beans , and a thin violet stalk of smoke went up . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown smelt the unmistakable sour smell of magic , and saw soundless words moving [Richard]164-richard 's little khaki moustache . Then [she]115-sarah brown found that [she]115-sarah brown had disappeared . [She]115-sarah brown had never done this before , [she]115-sarah brown had always been present to disturb and interrupt [herself]115-sarah brown . [She]115-sarah brown had never seen [the world]275-the world before , except through the little glazed peepholes , called eyes , through which [her]115-sarah brown everyday self rather wistfully believed that it could see . Now , of course , [she]115-sarah brown knew what seeing was , and for the first time [she]115-sarah brown was aware of the real sizes of things . [Poor man]2174-poor man measures all things by the size of [his]2174-poor man own foot . [He]2174-poor man looks complacently at the print of [his]2174-poor man boot in the mud , and notices that the ant which [he]2174-poor man crushed was not nearly as big as [his]2174-poor man foot , therefore the ant does not matter to [him]2174-poor man . [He]2174-poor man also notices that those same feet of [his]2174-poor man would not be able to walk to the moon within a reasonable time , therefore the moon does not matter to [him]2174-poor man . But [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown had disappeared , and therefore could not measure anything . The spider strode from hill to hill , with the wind rushing through the hair on [his]2174-poor man back . The blue sky was just a lampshade , clipped on to the earth to shield it from the glare of the gods , beyond it was a mere roof of eternity , pricked with a few billion stars to keep it well ventilated . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown had for a while all the fun of being [a god]2175-a god . [She]115-sarah brown was nowhere and [she]115-sarah brown was everywhere . [She]115-sarah brown could have counted the hairs on [David]185-david 's head . [The world]275-the world waved like a flower upon a thin purple stalk of smoke .... [Her]115-sarah brown eyes began to see again . [She]115-sarah brown was aware , of the hollowed tired eyes of [Richard]164-richard fixed upon [her]115-sarah brown . The dragon dawned once more upon [her]115-sarah brown sight , it was inquisitively watching developments , while pretending to claw a weed or two out of a neighbouring bean - row . The horizon was rusty with a rather heavy sunset . [The fields]2166-the fields were full of twilight and empty of fairies . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown came to [herself]115-sarah brown with a start , [she]115-sarah brown was shocked to find that [she]115-sarah brown had opened [her]115-sarah brown mouth to say something absolutely impossible to [Richard]164-richard . " The Horse [Vivian]196-vivian , who was so white as to be almost phosphorescent in the dusk , was now further illuminated by a little red light on [his]1010-his breast , and a little green light on [his]1010-his tail . [Richard]164-richard was fond of making elaborate and unnecessary arrangements like this , while neglecting to acquire skill in the more usual handicrafts . [The Enchanted Forest]813-the enchanted forest is only an accumulation of dreams , and from [every traveller]2186-every traveller through it it exacts toll in the shape of a dream . By way of receipt , to [every traveller]2186-every traveller it gives a darling memory that neither death nor [hell nor paradise]2188-hell nor paradise can efface . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown knew that [her]115-sarah brown dream and [Richard]164-richard 's could never meet . [She]115-sarah brown was not [a real woman]2193-a real woman , [she]115-sarah brown was morbidly bodiless . [She]115-sarah brown could not bear touch . [She]115-sarah brown had no pleasure in seeing or feeling the skin and homespun that encloses [men]483-men and [women]1400-women . [She]115-sarah brown ought really to have been born a poplar tree ; [a human body]2197-a human body was a gift wasted on [her]115-sarah brown . As [they]357-people passed along [the Green Ride]80-the green ride , the red light from the Horse [Vivian]196-vivian 's neck made a sort of heralding ghost before [them]357-people on the grass . "[1015-this century] And as for spells — [we]1014-we have started a new spell . That 's the curious part of this War . " There was a most abrupt and disturbing draught in [[Miss Ford]96-miss ford 's sleek and decorous flat]2245-miss ford 's sleek and decorous flat as [the witch]432-the witch and [the Mayor]306-the mayor entered [it]2245-miss ford 's sleek and decorous flat . The draught that intruded into [the flat]2253-the flat ruffled the neat hair of [five persons]2254-five persons , [Miss Ford]96-miss ford [herself]96-miss ford , [Lady Arabel Higgins]97-lady arabel , [Miss Ivy MacBee]128-miss macbee , [Mr. Bernard Tovey]127-mr. tovey , and [Mr. Darnby Frere]129-mr. frere . [Miss MacBee]128-miss macbee always seemed to be seated on tenterhooks , even in the most comfortable of chairs . [Her]128-miss macbee Spartan spine never consented graciously to the curves of cushions . [She]128-miss macbee had smooth padded hair and smooth padded manners , and [her]128-miss macbee eyes were magnified by thick pince - nez to a cow - like size . [Most people]1425-most people , especially [most women]2256-most women , were instinctively sorry for [her]128-miss macbee , because [she]128-miss macbee always looked a little clever and very uncomfortable . [Mr. Bernard Tovey]127-mr. tovey was [a blunt - nosed beaming person]2257-a blunt - nosed beaming person . [He]127-mr. tovey leaned forward abruptly whenever [he]127-mr. tovey spoke , thereby swinging a lock of hair into [his]127-mr. tovey right eye . [He]127-mr. tovey agreed so heartily with everything that was said that [people who addressed [him]127-mr. tovey]2258-people who addressed him were left with the happy impression that [they]2258-people who addressed him had said something Rather Good . This habit , combined with the fact that [he]127-mr. tovey never launched an independent remark , had given [him]127-mr. tovey the reputation of being one of [the best talkers in [Kensington]3-kensington]2259-the best talkers in kensington . [He]129-mr. frere knew almost everything , and therefore , while despising [the public]2261-the public for knowing so little , [he]129-mr. frere encouraged [it]2261-the public to continue wondering , so that [he]129-mr. frere might continue despising and instructing it . " [The policeman]2328-the policeman seemed to be troubled all the time by mosquitoes . "[1188-dear policeman] [I]0-i believe [you]1188-dear policeman have talked so much to - night that [you]1188-dear policeman have n't heard what a quiet night it is . [You]1188-dear policeman are smaller than a star , and yet [you]1188-dear policeman make more noise than all the stars together . [You]1188-dear policeman are not so cold as the moon , and yet [your]1188-dear policeman teeth chatter more loudly than hers . [She]115-sarah brown struck [her]115-sarah brown last match , lit the lantern , and looked round . There was no sound in [the house of Living Alone]1519-the house of living alone , [she]115-sarah brown thought there would never again be any magic sound there to penetrate to [her]115-sarah brown imprisoned hearing . The aprons hanging from the ceiling near the door flapped in the cold wind , and [she]115-sarah brown thought they were like grey bats in a cave . The breeze blew out the open lantern . Ah , how desolate , how desolate .... A piece of paper was impaled upon the counter by means of a headless hatpin . There was something very largely and badly written on it . " [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown climbed up [the short stairway]2399-the short stairway , painful step by painful step , to [[her]115-sarah brown cell]2400-her cell . [She]115-sarah brown sat on [her]115-sarah brown bed holding [her]115-sarah brown throbbing side , and breathing with fearful caution . [She]115-sarah brown looked at the empty grate . [She]115-sarah brown put a cigarette in [her]115-sarah brown mouth , the unconscious and futile answer of [the Dweller Alone]2401-the dweller alone to that blind hunger for comfort . But [she]115-sarah brown had no matches , and presently , dimly conscious that [her]115-sarah brown groping for comfort had lacked result , [she]115-sarah brown absently put another cigarette into [her]115-sarah brown mouth , and then felt [a fool]626-a fool . [She]115-sarah brown stared at the cold window . The sky seemed to be nailed carelessly to it by means of a crooked star or two . These are the terrible nights of Living Alone , when [you]2403-you have fever and sometimes think that [[your]2403-you beloved]2404-your beloved stands in the doorway to bring [you]2403-you comfort , and sometimes think that [you]2403-you have [no beloved]2405-no beloved , and that there is [no one]2406-no one left in [all the world]2407-all the world , no word , no warmth , nor ever a kindly candle to be lighted in that spotted darkness that walls up [your]2403-you hot sight . Again on those nights [you]2403-you dream that [you]2403-you have already done those genial things [your]2403-you body cries for , or perhaps That Other has done them . The fire is built and alight at last , a cup of something cool and beautifully sour stands ready to [your]2403-you hand , [you]2403-you can hear the delicious rattle of china on a tray in [the passage]2408-the passage — someone coming with food [you]2403-you would love to look at , and presently perhaps to eat ... when [you]2403-you feel better . But again and again [your]2403-you eyes open on the cold dumb darkness , and there is nothing but the wind and strange sinister emptiness creaking on the stair . These are the terrible nights of Living Alone , yet [no real lover of [that house]2410-that house and of [that state]2411-that state]2409-no real lover of that house and of that state would ever exchange one of those haunted and desert nights for a night spent watched , in soft warm places . [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown was not long left alone that night to look at the strip of moonlight on the cold ashes of [her]115-sarah brown fireplace . [The Shop below]2412-the shop below shook suddenly with many footfalls , and the metallic officious barking of [the Dog David]124-david rent the still air of [[her]115-sarah brown cell]2400-her cell . [A man]239-a man 's voice at the foot of [the stairs]1546-the stairs said : "[0-i] [I]0-i can hear a dog barking . " And [a woman]415-a woman 's voice followed it : "[0-i] [Angela]113-angela , [dear]1106-dear , is that [you]113-angela ? " [Sarah Brown]115-sarah brown was only aware of a vague and irksome disturbance .
